plunge (somebody/something) into somethi: to suddenly experience a difficult or unpleasant situation, or to make someone or something do this
A strike would plunge the country into chaos.
The house was suddenly plunged into darkness.
After the war, the family plunged into debt.
to begin to do something suddenly, without thinking about the possible results
Investors are plunging into the world of international bonds.
to start to experience a difficult or unpleasant situation, or to make someone or something start to experience it
After the war, Europe plunged into recession.
A disastrous Christmas period plunged the company into a cash crisis.
